c4

Class MoveList

  • java.lang.Object
    • c4.MoveList

  • public class MoveList
extends java.lang.Object
    Implementation of a move-list. Very useful for "move Back" or "next Move" functionality in games.
    Author:
    Markus Thill

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MoveList()
      Generate an empty move-list

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int[] getMoveList() 
      int getNextMove()
      Gets next move, if available.
      int getPrevMove()
      Get last move, that was put in the list
      boolean isEmpty() 
      boolean isNextMove() 
      boolean putMove(int col)
      Add move to the end of the list
      int readPrevMove()
      Like getPrevMove.
      void reset()
      Reset move-list

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • MoveList

        public MoveList()
        Generate an empty move-list

    • Method Detail

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Reset move-list

      • putMove

        public boolean putMove(int col)
        Add move to the end of the list
        Parameters:
        col - Move made
        Returns:
        false, if move-list is completly filled (MAXMOVES)

      • getPrevMove

        public int getPrevMove()
        Get last move, that was put in the list
        Returns:
        -1, if list is empty

      • readPrevMove

        public int readPrevMove()
        Like getPrevMove. But internal pointer is not moved
        Returns:
        -1, if list is empty

      • getNextMove

        public int getNextMove()
        Gets next move, if available. To get a value getPrevMove must be executed at least once.
        Returns:
        -1, if no next move

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Returns:
        true, if list is empty.

      • isNextMove

        public boolean isNextMove()
        Returns:
        true, if there is a next move.

      • getMoveList

        public int[] getMoveList()
        Returns:
        complete move-list as array
